headline: Does Parker-Hannifin’s Dividend and Aerospace Focus Reveal a Deeper Capital Allocation Shift for PH?
summary: Parker-Hannifin’s board has declared a regular quarterly cash dividend of US$1.80 per share, payable on March 6, 2026, to shareholders of record as of February 6, 2026, while the company prepares to release its Q2 fiscal 2026 earnings. Investor attention is increasingly centered on expectations for growth in the Aerospace Systems and Diversified Industrial segments, reinforced by recent acquisitions such as Curtis Instruments. We will now examine how the anticipated Q2 earnings, particularly...

headline: Parker-Hannifin: Fiscal Q2 Earnings Snapshot
summary: CLEVELAND (AP) — Parker-Hannifin Corp. PH) on Thursday reported fiscal second-quarter net income of $845 million. The Cleveland-based company said it had net income of $6.60 per share.

content.title: Parker-Hannifin: Fiscal Q2 Earnings Snapshot

headline: Parker Reports Fiscal 2026 Second Quarter Results
summary: Record Sales and Segment Operating Margin Drive Adjusted EPS GrowthCLEVELAND, Jan. 29, 2026 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Parker Hannifin Corporation (NYSE: PH), the global leader in motion and control technologies, today reported results for the quarter ended December 31, 2025, that included the following highlights (compared with the prior year period): Fiscal 2026 Second Quarter Highlights: Sales increased 9% to a record $5.2 billion; organic sales increased 6.6%Segment operating margin was 23.9%, an i
